discussion_comments.comment_body:
Would it be possible to just group all node dependencies, if they are only minor or lower?

And we may should exclude the `@prometheus/` fixed packages here, since they should not bump individually through renovate. I dont know, if renovate has the ability to understand if that package.json is part of an npm workspace.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
I also like to use

```
      "separateMajorMinor": true,
      "separateMultipleMajor": true,
```

That has the benefit that renovate still offers the lastest version before an major version bump. That useful, if the next major version of a dependencies is not compatible yet.

I would like to see the integration of an custom regex manager like this:

https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/blob/5a42485c22e5beb3da772b32fbfd18719793bc5e/renovate.json#L14-L26

With that, we can add hints across all the code to include them into the dependency management, like here:

https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/blob/5a42485c22e5beb3da772b32fbfd18719793bc5e/charts/prometheus/Chart.yaml#L3-L4

Thats also useful in context of https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/issues/16446
